Message.Title: Boeing engine issue -NTSB investigation
Message.Msg: 787 suffers "engine issue" on Charleston runway Boeing confirmed a 787 Dreamliner experienced "an engine issue" during runway testing, leading to an NTSB investigation. a ground emergency was declared at the airport at 4:07 p.m.

Message.Title: 787 plane parts fall off, extremely unusual
Message.Msg: This is extremely unusual to have parts coming off an engine, particularly a brand new engine," CBS News aviation and transportation safety analyst Mark Rosenker was quoted as saying. Boeing has suffered several problems with the 787 with design issues and delays

Message.Title: Boeing rates 1 of 10 worst managed
Message.Msg: Worst Managed A company is said to be only as good as the people running it. If that's the case, the following companies might have to do some serious rethinking about their management teams. In no particular order, the top 10 worst managed companies of 2010 are Alcoa, Janus Capital, Sirius XM, Jamba Juice, Yahoo, Boeing, Advanced Micro Devices, Time Warner, Cablevision and Alcatel-Lucent. In order for a company to suffer from poor management, it needs to have certain factors in place -- a weak financial outlook, a management team that seems able neither to lead nor to create and bad decisions about acquisitions of overpriced companies. in addition, they tend not to be industry leaders. Read more: Top 10 Worst Businesses |
Has he converted yet?

The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints has extensive teachings regarding the gathering of Israel and the restoration of the ten tribes. One of their main Articles of Faith written by Joseph Smith Jr. is as follows: "We believe in the literal gathering of Israel and in the restoration of the Ten Tribes; that Zion (the New Jerusalem) will be built upon the American continent; that Christ will reign personally upon the earth; and, that the earth will be renewed and receive its paradisiacal glory." (LDS Articles of Faith #10) The Book of Mormon is purported to be an ancient record written on plates made of gold by descendants of Joseph, and translated by Joseph Smith Jr. circa 1830. The LDS Church considers the Book of Mormon one of the main tools for the spiritual gathering of Israel. The Book of Mormon spells out the origins of Mormonism, based on the belief that the Lost Tribes of Israel sailed to the American continent and became identified by European explorers as the American Indians. DNA evidence has proved this to be false. So is all of Mormonism as false as Willard?

Message.Title: wgs order
Message.Msg: EL SEGUNDO, Calif., July 30, 2012 -- Boeing [NYSE: BA] has received a $338.7 million contract modification from the U.S. Air Force to produce and launch a tenth Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) satellite. The authorization includes production, launch site activities, initial orbital operations and checkout. Boeing is working with the Air Force on potential cost-effective upgrades that would further increase the WGS satellites' capacity and operational flexibility. In June, Boeing was contracted to implement an enhanced Wideband Digital Channelizer upgrade that provides a 90 percent improvement in satellite bandwidth -- with no additional cost to the government. The new channelizer will be included on satellites WGS-8 and beyond.

Message.Title: About that SC GE 787 engine failure
Message.Msg: What little info out there is. That its a contained damage in the Low pressure compressor, or turbines. The engine is on it way to GE for examination. Engine failure is reportable so the NTSB is all over it also. When a turbine fails it has one of to reasons. Either the turbine or blades had structural failure or something upstream went thru the turbine blades. Since it was contained its most likely FOD Foreign Object Damage, although it could be a blade failure, but more likely something upstream went thru the turbine. Disintegrating combustion chamber parts maybe. Not to unfairly cause suspicion, but short of obvious causes. This one will probably be considered. That is IAM and it great hatred of the SC plant and its non union workforce and desire for them to fail. In any case it all seems strange. Maybe we will hear from GE or Boeing. So far they are very quite. http://www.king5.com/news/local/787-engine-debris-south-carolina-164179876.html/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10823291&ref=rss
